page.title: 02CLAYTON VILLAGE
page.content: Clayton village lies at the base of the Downs.It is a small village without shops,the only amenity is a letter box.An elderly resident gave us information on how the village has changed during her lifetime. Early this century Clayton was a small farming community consisting of families who had lived there for hundreds of years.The present Jack and Jill pub used to be tiny with a village shop beside it.The local school now the village hall had between 20 and 25 pupils all of whom were taught by one teacher. Today the character of the village has changed,the cottages have been modernised,they have central heating,large gardens and swimming pools.The people who live there are mainly commuters.Visitors are tourists to the windmills or Downs walkers.
